extent.measure: I + 216 fols. + I (Fol. I and I* former pastedowns)

supportDesc.foliation: Foliated in pencil in the lower margin. Fol. 96 counted twice (f.96, f.96a)

binding.p: Barock binding from Zwettl, with dating blindtool on the upper board: 1783. Two schließe.

history.origin:
The manuscript was written in s. XII2; s. XIIex in the Cistercian Zwettl Abbey (Ziegler; Blume). On the basis of palaeographical study of the scribal hands, Haidinger suggests the manuscript was written in the mid or third quarter of the twelfth century.
Glassner and Haidinger (p. 74-5) argued on the basis of content and iconography that there is no doubt the Vatican MS Vat. lat. 643 served as a model for the Zwettl MS, which in turn was the model for the Klosterneuburg MS 685. The newest art historical study by Blume et al. demonstrated, however, that Klosterneuburg MS 685 could not have been copied from Zwettl MS 296, but both were copied from one and the same model. The scribe of MS Klosterneuburg 685 made fewer mistakes than his colleague (example: in the text on Scorpio the scribe of the Zwettl MS left out the phrase in fronte vero tres, which is present in the Klosterneuburg MS). The model was not Vat. lat. 643, but a MS which was a model for the MS Vat. lat. 643. The two austrian MSS have also iconographical differences compared to the Vat. lat. 643; they are nearer to the iconography of Paris, BnF, lat. 5543; the model was possibly coming from Fleury (Blume, p. 564).
history.provenance: Cistercian Zwettl Abbey. Zeigler noted that both codicological units are mentioned as one codex in the thirteenth-century catalogue (Zwettl, SB, Cod. 24, f. 309v) Beda de temporibus. Augustinus in librum retractacionum. De opere monachorum. Augustinus super Genesim ad litteram, and in the catalogue from ca. 1620/1640 (now in Vienna, ÖNB, Cod. 9520, f. 7v).

msItem.note: Not on the contents by Nicolaus von Dibersberg: Item Beda presbyter super natura rerum bestiarum alia in fine
Medical recipies (6 lines, 12th early 13th c. hand). Rest of the page left blank.

Rota divided by the twelf zodiacal signs and segments for the sun, moon and the five planets with information how long its path around the zodiac lasts. Around the rota, commentary (upper part partly cut off by trimming). In the lower half of the page another diagram: circle with the sun, the moon and the five planets.

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: De natura rerum
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt uersus Bede presbyteri Incipit liber Nedae presbyteri de natura rerum. Incipiunt capitula

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: De temporibus
msItem.explicit: Reliquum sexte etatis deo soli patet.

msItem.title: Opusculum Itaque stella veneris et mercurii
msItem.rubric: De stella ueneris et mercurii, saturni, iouis et martis
msItem.incipit: Itaque stella ueneris et mercurii hoc a superioribus tribus planetarum stellis differunt

msItem.title: De absidibus planetarum
msItem.incipit: Circulus zodiacus qui XII signis constat omni ex parte eque uicinus est terre
msItem.explicit: quam uelocitatis cum aut pisces aut uirginem transit. Quod subiecta melius pictura declarabitur.

msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: De temporum ratione
msItem.rubric: Incipit praefacio libri bedae presbyteri de temporibus
msItem.note: Interlinear and marginal glosses from a contemporary hand.
On the simultaneous rising and settings of the zodiacal constellations
msItem.incipit: Ariete oriente duabus horis occidit libra et centrum superioris zodiaci tunc capra inferioris optinet cancer

msItem.note: Computistical method for determining the rising of the zodiacal signs
msItem.incipit: Ortum signorum XII qualibet diei uel noctis hora quasque liquido deprehensurus est
msItem.explicit: Leo si XXIII aut XXIIII uirgo.

msItem.note: Computistical method for forecasting solar and lunar eclipses
msItem.incipit: Deliquium solis contigisse fertur anno ab incarnatione domini DCCCVIIIo
msItem.explicit: Quod quotiens contigerit tociens eclypsin non defecturam.

msItem.title: In quo signo versetur Mars
msItem.incipit: In quo signo uersetur mars annis ab initio mundi
Primo sciendum est quod in toto decennouenali circulo unu dies de saltu lunae accrescat
msItem.explicit: crescit saltus lune minutum et unciam unius memnti et athomum.

msItem.incipit: Novem horis in luna pro V diebus in sole computatis
msItem.explicit: VIIII horae lunares cum quinque diebus solaris concordare.

msItem.rubric: De quibus embolismi menses et bissextiles dies adimplentur
msItem.incipit: Luna ergo cottidie et caetera transit XIII partes et horas VIII et VIII senis momenta et athomum I tricesima pars trium momentorum
msItem.explicit: et ad quam cernendam mentis acies purganda.

msItem.title: Anonymous commentary on Bede's DTR
msItem.rubric: De natura rerum et temporum ratione
msItem.incipit: Non est praetermitendum cum dixit de natura rerum cur non etiam de natura temporum uel de ratione rerum et ratione temporum dixit
msItem.explicit: Igitur XXX tria semis momenta et athomum I CCma XXXV pars XLVII semis momentorum.
msItem.note: On ff.83r-v on the names and mythical storis of the zodiacal signs.

msItem.rubric: Quid est epacta solis et regulares solis
msItem.incipit: Dum audis epactas lunae aetates lunae per singulos annos intellige
msItem.explicit: quot dies usque ad kalendas futuri mensis supersunt.

msItem.note: Short poem on the path of the planets around the zodiac
msItem.explicit: Proxima telluri dum curris candida phebae.
msItem.note: ed. Walther, 2200, Schaller 1977, 1725; Baehrens, Poetae Latini minores, vol. 5, p. 350, lin. 15-351, lin 9).

msItem.decoNote: Two diagrams of celestial and terrestrial circles.

msItem.title: De signis coelis (redaction incl AL)
msItem.incipit: Quodam tamen multa dicunt et alii aliter narrasse
msItem.note: In contrast to the MS Vat. lat. 643 where on fol. 97r the scribe left blank space for the missing text from the AL, in the two Austrian MS there is no space left (Blume, p. 563).
not to be found in the sister MS Klosterneuburg or in the related Vat. lat. 643 (Blume, p. 563)

listBibl.bibl: Duits, Rembrandt. Celestial Transmission. An Iconographical Classification of Constellation Cycles in Manuscripts (8th-15th Centuries). Scriptorium 59 (2005) 147-202, n. 57, 189 (Nr. 53).

Glaßner, Christine and Alois Haidinger. Die Anfänge der Melker Bibliothek. Neue Erkenntnisse zu Handschriften und Fragmenten aus der Zeit vor 1200. Präsentiert im Rahmen der Sonderausstellung aus Anlaß '1000 Jahre Ostarrichi'. Melk 1996, 74-78.
Haidinger, Alois. Verborgene Schönheit. Die Buchkunst im Stift Klosterneuburg. Katalog zur Sonderausstellung 1998 des Stiftsmuseums Klosterneuburg. Klosterneuburg 1998, Nr. 13.

Die Kuenringer. Das Werden des Landes Niederösterreich. Niederösterreichische Landesausstellung. Stift Zwettl, 16. Mai - 26. Oktober 1981 (Katalog des Niederösterreichischen Landesmuseums N.F. 110). Vienna 1981, 235-238 Nr. 241 (A. Haidinger).
Weber, Dorothea. Die handschriftliche Überlieferung der Werke des heiligen Augustinus VI, 1-2: Österreich. Vienna, 1993 .
Ziegler, Charlotte. Zisterzienserstift Zwettl. Katalog der Handschriften des Mittelalters, Teil III: Codex 201-300 (Scriptorium ordinis Cisterciensium). Wien-München, 1989, pp. 239-243.
